sourceMeaningMnemonic: You have an <radical>animal</radical> and you <radical>say</radical> it’s a <radical>dog</radical> to prevent it from going to <kanji>prison</kanji>. Dogs are the only animals that don’t have to go to prison. Your animal is not a dog, but you say it is to prevent it from going to prison.
meaningInfo: Imagine any animal that’s not a dog. Now imagine dressing it up like a dog so it doesn’t have to go to prison. Practice throwing your voice by saying “woof woof” aloud to help convince people that your animal is actually a dog.
readingMnemonic: What is the name of your animal? Your animal is named <reading>Goku</reading> (<ja>ごく</ja>). Yeah, like Goku from Dragon Ball Z. You don’t want your little Goku to go to <kanji>prison</kanji>, so you say that he’s a dog.
readingInfo: Poor little Goku doesn’t want to go to prison either so Goku does his best to act like a dog even though he isn’t. How adorable.
